content.question: Based on the information in the table, which of the following reactions is thermodynamically favorable?

choices.label: <math alttext="3 N i, solid, plus 2 C r with a positive 3 charge, aqueous, reacts to produce 3 N i with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus 2 C r, solid" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>Ni</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mi>Cr</mi><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mi>Ni</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>Cr</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>

<math alttext="3 F e, solid, plus 2 C r with a positive 3 charge, aqueous, reacts to produce 3 F e with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus 2 C r, solid" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>Fe</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mi>Cr</mi><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mi>Fe</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>Cr</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>

<math alttext="3 N i with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus 2 C r, solid, reacts to produce 3 N i, solid, plus 2 C r with a positive 3 charge, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><msup><mi>Ni</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi>Cr</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi>Ni</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><msup><mi>Cr</mi><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>

<math alttext="3 F e with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus 2 N i, solid, reacts to produce 3 F e, solid, plus 2 N i with a positive 2 charge, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><msup><mi>Fe</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi>Ni</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi>Fe</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><msup><mi>Ni</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="3 N i with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus 2 C r, solid, reacts to produce 3 N i, solid, plus 2 C r with a positive 3 charge, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><msup><mi>Ni</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi>Cr</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi>Ni</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><msup><mi>Cr</mi><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>

skill.text: 5.E: Determine a balanced chemical equation for a given chemical phenomenon.
